question: What is the deadline given to the Public Sector Undertakings to pay Customs Duty, after they clear the imported goods?
explanation:
Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) has recently announced that the Public Sector Undertakings (PSUs) are permitted to first clear the goods imported by them through Customs and then pay Customs duty within 14 days.
This measure is a part of the ‘Turant Customs’ initiative which seeks to introduce a Faceless and Paperless Customs environment. This announcement will lead to faster clearance of the goods imported by the PSUs.
